firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to support Nigran's multi-module tracking system (child, animal, vehicle) while prioritizing security and scalability. Authorization Independence is achieved through path-based ownership (`/users/{userId}/...`) and denormalization (copying relevant user/device data where needed to avoid `get()` calls in security rules). Homogeneous Security Posture is ensured by segregating data based on ownership and function. All data directly related to a user (devices, geofences, alerts) are stored under the `users/{userId}` path. Location data is nested under devices (`/users/{userId}/devices/{deviceId}/locations`) to associate location readings with specific devices owned by the user. Roles are managed through dedicated collections. This design enables efficient and secure `list` operations (QAPs) by ensuring that all documents within a collection share the same security requirements, avoiding filtering within rules.
